meanings.definition: To mark or designate with an obelisk.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist decided to obelise the ancient ruins for future generations to admire.
meanings.sent2: The city council plans to obelise the historical sites to highlight their significance.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, the mischievous kids obelised their friend's favorite tree with colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent4: The artist obelised the skyline with bold strokes, capturing the essence of the city.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to obelise the important dates in their textbooks for easy reference.

meanings.definition: To criticize or call attention to as being incorrect or unacceptable.
meanings.sent1: The editor decided to obelise the article for its factual errors.
meanings.sent2: It is important to obelise discriminatory behavior to promote inclusivity.
meanings.sent3: The comedian obelised the outdated fashion trends in a hilarious stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Her words obelised the flaws in the system, sparking a much-needed conversation.
meanings.sent5: The coach obelised the player's poor sportsmanship, emphasizing the importance of fair play.
